item.title: Retro App Breakdown
item.description:
I have started to breakdown mobile apps and make sense of why something exists within an app and what could have been better. Last weekend, I went through Retro App. You can go through the breakdown here . If you want to go through the onboarding experience, you can do so here.

A couple of interesting observations that I came across while going through the app:

  1. Unlike Instagram’s social graph, Retro app has purposefully focused on restricting what you can see and share with your friends. Not with any random stranger on the internet
  2. It pushes the users to create content or share their pictures and discourages passive viewing weeding out lurkers early in their user journey.

If you want to see the breakdown of a specific app, feel free to DM me your request on Twitter.

item.title: Deep Dives - Maker DAO
item.description:
Maker DAO is a well-known protocol that has been a pioneer in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space. In 2021, Maker Foundation took a significant step towards decentralization by dissolving itself and spinning up a DAO. As someone who has delved deep into the inner workings of Maker DAO over the past two weeks, I’ve gathered valuable insights and resources that will help anyone start contributing to Maker DAO.

Major Events

  1. The End Game Proposal - Last year, Rune Christensen, the founder of Maker DAO, put forth a proposal that outlined the constitution and end game for Maker DAO. This proposal aimed to streamline the governance structure and achieve true decentralization. This proposal has been considered one of the largest restructurings in its history and the proposal has passed with significant support.
